data.explanation: A pronoun is used instead of a noun. He replaces the name of a person.

data.explanation: Relative pronouns refer back to a noun and join clauses.

I know who man lives here
I know the man which lives here

medium.question:
Which pronoun correctly completes the sentence?
He will be glad to see ______.

data.statement: He will be glad to see them.

data.statement: Rahul, you are very lazy.

data.explanation: They refers to plural nouns.

data.explanation: Us is an object pronoun for we.

data.explanation: Mine shows ownership and stands alone.

medium.question: Which word is a possessive pronoun?

data.statement: This book is mine.

data.explanation: Possessive pronouns do not come before nouns and do not use apostrophes.

data.explanation: Yours shows possession and stands alone.

data.statement: That house is ours.

data.statement: He needs to see us.

medium.question: Select the pronoun from the sentence.

data.explanation: This points to a specific thing nearby.

medium.question: Which word is a demonstrative pronoun?

data.statement: That is my house.

medium.question: Select the demonstrative pronoun from the sentence.

data.explanation: These refers to plural objects that are near.

medium.question: Which demonstrative pronoun refers to nearby plural objects?

data.statement: These are my books.

medium.question: Select the demonstrative pronoun from the sentence.

data.explanation: Those refers to plural objects that are far away.

medium.question: Which demonstrative pronoun refers to far plural objects?

data.statement: Those are my shoes.

medium.question: Select the demonstrative pronoun from the sentence.

data.explanation: She replaces a female noun.

data.explanation: Me is used as the object of the verb invited.
